contents: Article 4 (Accounting) ① Economic transactions, etc. that occur in the management activities of the Corporation must be accounted for using double-entry bookkeeping based on the time of occurrence. ② Accounting objectively and fairly measures the substance of economic facts and transactions. Records are processed to faithfully display the Corporation's financial status, management performance, cash flow, and capital changes., [Fully revised on September 12, 2013]
